014package org.jdbi.v3.sqlobject;
015
016import java.lang.annotation.Annotation;
017import java.lang.reflect.AnnotatedElement;
018import java.lang.reflect.Method;
019import java.lang.reflect.Modifier;
020import java.lang.reflect.Proxy;
021import java.util.Arrays;
022import java.util.Collections;
023import java.util.HashMap;
024import java.util.HashSet;
025import java.util.LinkedHashSet;
026import java.util.List;
027import java.util.Map;
028import java.util.Optional;
029import java.util.Set;
030import java.util.function.Consumer;
031import java.util.function.Function;
032import java.util.function.Supplier;
033import java.util.function.UnaryOperator;
034import java.util.stream.Collectors;
035import java.util.stream.Stream;
036
037import org.jdbi.v3.core.Jdbi;
038import org.jdbi.v3.core.config.ConfigRegistry;
039import org.jdbi.v3.core.config.JdbiCache;
040import org.jdbi.v3.core.config.JdbiCaches;
041import org.jdbi.v3.core.extension.ExtensionFactory;
042import org.jdbi.v3.core.extension.Extensions;
043import org.jdbi.v3.core.extension.HandleSupplier;
044import org.jdbi.v3.core.internal.OnDemandExtensions;
045import org.jdbi.v3.sqlobject.config.Configurer;
046import org.jdbi.v3.sqlobject.config.ConfiguringAnnotation;
047import org.jdbi.v3.sqlobject.internal.SqlObjectInitData;
048import org.jdbi.v3.sqlobject.internal.SqlObjectInitData.InContextInvoker;
049
050/**
051 * Creates implementations for SqlObject interfaces.
052 */
053public class SqlObjectFactory implements ExtensionFactory, OnDemandExtensions.Factory {
054    private final JdbiCache<Class<?>, SqlObjectInitData> sqlObjectCache =
055            JdbiCaches.declare(SqlObjectFactory::initDataFor);
056
057    SqlObjectFactory() {}
058
059    @Override
060    public boolean accepts(Class<?> extensionType) {
061        if (looksLikeSqlObject(extensionType)) {
062            if (extensionType.getAnnotation(GenerateSqlObject.class) != null) {
063                return true;
064            }
065
066            if (!extensionType.isInterface()) {
067                throw new IllegalArgumentException("SQL Objects are only supported for interfaces.");
068            }
069
070            return true;
071        }
072
073        return false;
074    }
075
076    private boolean looksLikeSqlObject(Class<?> extensionType) {
077        if (SqlObject.class.isAssignableFrom(extensionType)) {
078            return true;
079        }
080
081        return Stream.of(extensionType.getMethods())
082                .flatMap(m -> Stream.of(m.getAnnotations()))
083                .anyMatch(a -> a.annotationType().isAnnotationPresent(SqlOperation.class));
084    }
085
086    /**
087     * Create a sql object of the specified type bound to this handle. Any state changes to the handle, or the sql
088     * object, such as transaction status, closing it, etc, will apply to both the object and the handle.
089     *
090     * @param extensionType the type of sql object to create
091     * @param handle the Handle instance to attach ths sql object to
092     * @return the new sql object bound to this handle
093     */
094    @Override
095    public <E> E attach(Class<E> extensionType, HandleSupplier handle) {
096        final SqlObjectInitData data = sqlObjectCache.get(extensionType, handle.getConfig());
097        final ConfigRegistry instanceConfig = data.configureInstance(handle.getConfig().createCopy());
098
099        if (data.isConcrete()) {
100            return data.instantiate(extensionType, handle, instanceConfig);
101        }
102        instanceConfig.get(Extensions.class).onCreateProxy();
103
104        Map<Method, Supplier<InContextInvoker>> handlers = new HashMap<>();
105        final Object proxy = Proxy.newProxyInstance(
106                extensionType.getClassLoader(),
107                new Class[] {extensionType},
108                (p, m, a) -> handlers.get(m).get().invoke(a));
109
110        data.forEachMethodHandler((m, h) ->
111                handlers.put(m, data.lazyInvoker(proxy, m, handle, instanceConfig)));
112        return extensionType.cast(proxy);
113    }
114
115    @Override
116    public Optional<Object> onDemand(Jdbi db, Class<?> extensionType, Class<?>... extraTypes) {
117        SqlObjectInitData data = sqlObjectCache.get(extensionType, db);
118        if (!data.isConcrete()) {
119            return Optional.empty();
120        }
121        try {
122            return Optional.of(Class.forName(
123                    extensionType.getPackage().getName() + "." + extensionType.getSimpleName() + "Impl$OnDemand")
124                .getConstructor(Jdbi.class)
125                .newInstance(db));
126        } catch (ReflectiveOperationException | ExceptionInInitializerError e) {
127            throw new UnableToCreateSqlObjectException(e);
128        }
129    }
130
131    private static Map<Method, Handler> buildMethodHandlers(
132            Class<?> sqlObjectType,
133            Handlers registry,
134            HandlerDecorators decorators) {
135        final Map<Method, Handler> handlers = new HashMap<>();
136
137        handlers.putAll(handlerEntry((t, a, h) ->
138                sqlObjectType.getName() + '@' + Integer.toHexString(t.hashCode()),
139            Object.class, "toString"));
140        handlers.putAll(handlerEntry((t, a, h) -> t == a[0], Object.class, "equals", Object.class));
141        handlers.putAll(handlerEntry((t, a, h) -> System.identityHashCode(t), Object.class, "hashCode"));
142        handlers.putAll(handlerEntry((t, a, h) -> h.getHandle(), SqlObject.class, "getHandle"));
143        try {
144            handlers.putAll(handlerEntry((t, a, h) -> null, sqlObjectType, "finalize"));
145        } catch (IllegalStateException expected) {
146            // optional implementation
147        }
148
149        final Set<Method> methods = new LinkedHashSet<>();
150        methods.addAll(Arrays.asList(sqlObjectType.getMethods()));
151        methods.addAll(Arrays.asList(sqlObjectType.getDeclaredMethods()));
152
153        final Set<Method> seen = handlers.keySet().stream()
154                .collect(Collectors.toCollection(HashSet::new));
155        for (Method method : methods) {
156            if (Modifier.isStatic(method.getModifiers()) || !seen.add(method)) {
157                continue;
158            }
159            handlers.put(method, decorators.applyDecorators(
160                        registry.findFor(sqlObjectType, method)
161                            .orElseGet(() -> {
162                                Supplier<IllegalStateException> x = () -> new IllegalStateException(String.format(
163                                        "Method %s.%s must have an implementation or be annotated with a SQL method annotation.",
164                                        method.getDeclaringClass().getSimpleName(),
165                                        method.getName()));
166                                if (!SqlObjectInitData.isConcrete(sqlObjectType) && !method.isSynthetic() && !Modifier.isPrivate(method.getModifiers())) {
167                                    throw x.get();
168                                }
169                                return (t, a, h) -> {
170                                    throw x.get();
171                                };
172                            }),
173                        sqlObjectType,
174                        method));
175        }
176
177        methods.stream()
178            .filter(m -> !m.isSynthetic())
179            .collect(Collectors.groupingBy(m -> Arrays.asList(m.getName(), Arrays.asList(m.getParameterTypes()))))
180            .values()
181            .stream()
182            .filter(l -> l.size() > 1)
183            .findAny()
184            .ifPresent(ms -> {
185                throw new UnableToCreateSqlObjectException(sqlObjectType + " has ambiguous methods " + ms + ", please resolve with an explicit override");
186            });
187
188        return handlers;
189    }
190
191    private static Map<Method, Handler> handlerEntry(Handler handler, Class<?> klass, String methodName, Class<?>... parameterTypes) {
192        return Collections.singletonMap(Handlers.methodLookup(klass, methodName, parameterTypes), handler);
193    }
194
195    private static UnaryOperator<ConfigRegistry> buildConfigurers(Stream<AnnotatedElement> elements, ConfigurerMethod consumer) {
196        List<Consumer<ConfigRegistry>> myConfigurers = elements
197                .flatMap(ae -> Arrays.stream(ae.getAnnotations()))
198                .filter(a -> a.annotationType().isAnnotationPresent(ConfiguringAnnotation.class))
199                .map(a -> {
200                    ConfiguringAnnotation meta = a.annotationType()
201                            .getAnnotation(ConfiguringAnnotation.class);
202
203                    Configurer configurer = getConfigurer(meta.value());
204                    return (Consumer<ConfigRegistry>) config -> consumer.configure(configurer, config, a);
205                })
206                .collect(Collectors.toList());
207        return config -> {
208            myConfigurers.forEach(configurer -> configurer.accept(config));
209            return config;
210        };
211    }
212
213    private static Configurer getConfigurer(Class<? extends Configurer> factoryClass) {
214        try {
215            return factoryClass.getDeclaredConstructor().newInstance();
216        } catch (ReflectiveOperationException e) {
217            throw new IllegalStateException("Unable to instantiate configurer factory class " + factoryClass, e);
218        }
219    }
220
221    static SqlObjectInitData initDataFor(ConfigRegistry handlersConfig, Class<?> sqlObjectType) {
222        Map<Method, Handler> methodHandlers = buildMethodHandlers(
223                sqlObjectType,
224                handlersConfig.get(Handlers.class),
225                handlersConfig.get(HandlerDecorators.class));
226
227        UnaryOperator<ConfigRegistry> instanceConfigurer = buildConfigurers(
228                Stream.concat(
229                    superTypes(sqlObjectType),
230                    Stream.of(sqlObjectType)),
231                (configurer, config, annotation) ->
232                    configurer.configureForType(config, annotation, sqlObjectType));
233
234        Map<Method, UnaryOperator<ConfigRegistry>> methodConfigurers =
235            methodHandlers.keySet().stream().collect(
236                Collectors.toMap(
237                        Function.identity(),
238                        method -> buildConfigurers(
239                            Stream.of(method),
240                            (configurer, config, annotation) ->
241                                configurer.configureForMethod(config, annotation, sqlObjectType, method))));
242
243        return new SqlObjectInitData(
244                sqlObjectType,
245                instanceConfigurer,
246                methodConfigurers,
247                methodHandlers);
248    }
249
250    // duplicate implementation in CustomizingStatementHandler
251    private static Stream<Class<?>> superTypes(Class<?> type) {
252        Class<?>[] interfaces = type.getInterfaces();
253        return Stream.concat(
254            Arrays.stream(interfaces).flatMap(SqlObjectFactory::superTypes),
255            Arrays.stream(interfaces));
256    }
257
258    interface ConfigurerMethod {
259        void configure(Configurer configurer, ConfigRegistry config, Annotation annotation);
260    }
261}
